params.name: node
params.description: Plain object to use as template for node.

ast-node.AstNode.description: Creates an AST node from a plain object.
examples: var node = new AstNode({type: 'string', value: 'Hello, world!'});
ast-node.AstNode.name: AstNode

signatures.description: Gets an item value from a node.
Sets an item value for a particular node.

ast-node.AstNode.walk.description: Walk this node and its children, using the registered walk method. When a node is appended, this is used to run all the rules for the appended node and its children.
ast-node.AstNode.walk.name: walk

ast-node.AstNode.prepend.description: Insert a new child node before any other child nodes.
ast-node.AstNode.prepend.name: prepend

ast-node.AstNode.append.description: Insert a new child node after any other child nodes.
ast-node.AstNode.append.name: append

ast-node.AstNode.lispify.description: Return a lisp-like representation of this node. Useful while creating rules. Gives you a terse look at the AST.
ast-node.AstNode.lispify.name: lispify

ast-node.AstNode.like.description: Returns true if this node has everything that node has.
ast-node.AstNode.like.name: like

ast-node.AstNode.equal.description: Return true if this node is idential to node.
ast-node.AstNode.equal.name: equal

returns.description: The PEG parser used in creating this AST.

ast-node.AstNode.likeSource.description: Compare this node to some arbitrary source. The source string will be compiled to an AST, using the same grammar that was used to create this node.
ast-node.AstNode.likeSource.name: likeSource

ast-node.AstNode.ast.description: Return an AST without the sibling and parent references.
ast-node.AstNode.ast.name: ast

cli.anonymous.description: Map command-line arguments to doctor's examine function.
cli.anonymous.name: anonymous

params.name: cb
params.description: {function} Function to call when doctor is finished.

doctor.examine.description: Parses the AST of a set of JavaScript files, uses report rules to convert the AST into a report, and optionally combines the report with the view or renders the report into an output format.
doctor.examine.name: examine

doctor.harmony.description: EXPERIMENTAL! (and not even close to finished) Registers a compiler for the .js extension that will compile harmony files to ECMAScript 5.
doctor.harmony.name: harmony

params.name: options
params.description: {Object|RegExp} Pass in a regular expression apply the compiler only to paths matching that regular expression.

params.name: enterCb
params.description: {Function} Calls this function (passing it info) when a function is entered.

params.name: exitCb
params.description: {Fucntion} Calls this function (passing it info) when a function is exited.

doctor.hookEnterExit.description: EXPERIMENTAL! Registers a compiler for the .js extension that will catch function entry/exit.
doctor.hookEnterExit.name: hookEnterExit

params.name: filename
params.description: {String} Filename of file to trasform. Callback hooks are registered to this filename.

params.name: enterCb
params.description: {Function} Function to call when entering function. If exitCb is not defined, enterCb will be called for exit as well.

params.name: exitCb
params.description: {Function} Function to call when exiting function.

doctor.insertEnterExitHooksSync.description: EXPERIMENTAL Inserts enter/exit hooks into a JavaScript file. Registers callback hooks for that file.
doctor.insertEnterExitHooksSync.name: insertEnterExitHooksSync

post-process.renamePackageItems.description: Rename modules to their corresponding package names, if provided, via a package.json file.
post-process.renamePackageItems.name: renamePackageItems

post-process.hoistRequiredItems.description: If a module exports another required module, treat the required module as if its exports were owned by this module.
post-process.hoistRequiredItems.name: hoistRequiredItems

post-process.postProcessReport.description:
Use package names if available, and handle cases like:
module.exports = require('foo');
post-process.postProcessReport.name: postProcessReport

render.render.description: Render the report with the render modules supplied in the options.
render.render.name: render

report.Report.run.description: Run the report through the supplied report rules.
report.Report.run.name: run

transform.transform.description: Transform the AST with the supplied transform rules.
transform.transform.name: transform

util.callbackify.description: turn synchronous things into callbacks to they can stand in for asynchronous things
util.callbackify.name: callbackify

util.compareFileDates.description: Compare the modified time stamps of two files.
util.compareFileDates.name: compareFileDates

util.findRules.description: Require the specified rule modules, either from the default location or from the user-specified location.
util.findRules.name: findRules

util.findFunctions.description: Require the specified function modules, either in the default location or the user-specified location.
util.findFunctions.name: findFunctions

params.name: elseCb
params.description: If one is not found, do this.

util.findFile.description: Find one of a list of files.
util.findFile.name: findFile

params.name: elseCb
params.description: If one is not found, do this.

util.findDir.description: Find one of a list of directories.
util.findDir.name: findDir

util.localizePaths.description: Compress fully-qualified paths down to minimal non-colliding lengths.
util.localizePaths.name: localizePaths
